abstract: Coca-Cola’s directors approved the purchase of Glaceau, the maker of Vitaminwater, for $4.2 billion.
snippet: Coca-Cola’s directors approved the purchase of Glaceau, the maker of Vitaminwater, for $4.2 billion.
lead_paragraph: Directors of the Coca-Cola Company last night approved the purchase of Glaceau, the maker of Vitaminwater, for $4.2 billion in cash and Coke stock, according to an executive involved in the negotiations.

headline.main: Coca-Cola Is Said to Buy Vitaminwater
headline.print_headline: Coca-Cola Is Said to Buy Vitaminwater

byline.original: By Andrew Ross Sorkin and Andrew Martin

abstract: The Coca-Cola Company said Friday it would buy Glaceau, the maker of Vitaminwater, for $4.1 billion. It would be Coke’s largest acquisition ever, and the price tag is more than the amount of cash Coke had on hand at the end of last quarter, meaning it will need to use debt to finance the all-cash deal. Shareholders seemed to find the deal refreshing: They bid up Coke shares by 1.4 percent in late-morning trading.
lead_paragraph: The Coca-Cola Company said Friday it would buy Glaceau, the maker of Vitaminwater, for $4.1 billion. It would be Coke’s largest acquisition ever, and the price tag is more than the amount of cash Coke had on hand at the end of last quarter, meaning it will need to use debt to finance the all-cash deal. Shareholders seemed to find the deal refreshing: They bid up Coke shares by 1.4 percent in late-morning trading.

headline.main: Coca-Cola Pulls Out the Stops for Glaceau Deal
